intro: Stephanogastra, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers that are typically arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. The plants are perennial herbs with alternate, simple, and usually palmately lobed leaves. They are native to regions of Europe and Asia, often growing in moist, wooded areas. The flowers are generally hermaphroditic, with both male and female reproductive structures present.
